body_html:
I've updated numbers with sync points. TensorFlow CPU version probably benefits from being optimized for AWS by the DLAMI team (probably compiled with MKL and env vars like OMP affinity are properly set for p3.2xlarge machine)

Benchmarking n=10000
numpy
Times: min: 203.06, median: 203.48, mean: 204.37
Pytorch GPU
Times: min: 6.47, median: 6.53, mean: 6.64
Pytorch CPU
Times: min: 254.77, median: 263.34, mean: 268.56
TF GPU
Times: min: 11.65, median: 11.70, mean: 11.69
TF CPU
Times: min: 62.13, median: 63.75, mean: 63.86

body:
I've updated numbers with sync points. TensorFlow CPU version probably benefits from being optimized for AWS by the DLAMI team (probably compiled with MKL and env vars like OMP affinity are properly set for p3.2xlarge machine)

```
Benchmarking n=10000
numpy
Times: min: 203.06, median: 203.48, mean: 204.37
Pytorch GPU
Times: min: 6.47, median: 6.53, mean: 6.64
Pytorch CPU
Times: min: 254.77, median: 263.34, mean: 268.56
TF GPU
Times: min: 11.65, median: 11.70, mean: 11.69
TF CPU
Times: min: 62.13, median: 63.75, mean: 63.86
```
